title: Kinder Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Stephen Horncastle / Kinder Reservoir
images.caption: Looking south to the reservoir, most of which is in the grid square.

images.title: Dave Dunford / Intake, Kinder Reservoir
images.caption: Intake, Kinder Reservoir. Stone-built inspection chamber in the western corner of the Reservoir. The initials of the Stockport Corporation Water Works are carved in stone over the door.

images.title: Katy Walters / William Clough arm of Kinder Reservoir
images.caption: William Clough arm of Kinder Reservoir. Water levels were low at the time, exposing evidence of previous water levels.

images.title: michael ely / Climbing up to Kinder Reservoir
images.caption: A mountain biker climbs up to the reservoir. They are seen here ascending the steep bridleway towards the northern end of Kinder Reservoir dam. This bridleway forms part of a great moorland crossing between Oaken Clough and the A624 Snake Pass road.

images.title: John Fielding / Looking to the east arm of Kinder Reservoir
images.caption: Looking to the east arm of the Reservoir. From below White Brow, the skyline is Kinder Scout with the Pennine Way on the edge.

images.title: Stephen Burton / Kinder Reservoir Water Outlet
images.caption: Water Outlet. The Reservoir is fed by the River Kinder flowing down from Kinder Scout. It was built in 1911.

description: This walk takes you to Kinder Reservoir from Hayfield along the Snake Path. The reservoir is very pretty with the backdrop of woodland, fields and Peak District hills. The walk starts in Hayfield where you will find the Snake Path turning on your left as you leave the village. You then follow it for about 2 miles to the reservoir where there is a footpath along the water. Follow the path up to William Clough for great views over the water. You could extend the walk and continue up William Clough and then pick up the Pennine Way and follow it to Kinder Scout. Our circular walk to Kinder Downfall also passes the reservoir. It will take you to the tallest waterfall in the Peak District from Hayfield.
